thread.title: This Guy Failed In 8th Std But Now IITians Want To Work Under Him! Read His Extraordinary Story!
thread.title_full: This Guy Failed In 8th Std But Now IITians Want To Work Under Him! Read His Extraordinary Story!

author: Shuchi Bhatnagar
title: This Guy Failed In 8th Std But Now IITians Want To Work Under Him! Read His Extraordinary Story!
text:
by Shuchi Bhatnagar - Feb 18, 2017 
A student with good academic record is expected to achieve big in life while the person who is not good in studies is seen as a gone case and this particular statement holds correct especially in India as much importance is given to schools and degrees. 
But if you come across the profile of Trishneet Arora, you will find that if you are dedicated and passionate towards achieving your goal, then even a 8th standard fail can build a multi-million dollar business and that too at the age of 21. 
Source 
Sounds shocking and unbelievable, doesn’t it? The client list of Trishneet includes companies like Reliance, CBI, Gujarat Police, Punjab Police, Avon Cycles and Amul. 
Presently, Trishneet is 23 and is the head of TAC Security which deals in cyber security. The guy is basically from Ludhiana and from childhood only, he was interested in computers a lot. Slowly, his interest became his obsession and then he started gathering information about hacking. He was totally hooked off from studies and left standard 8 in between. 
Source 
After his results of class 8, everybody laughed at him while his parents were very angry with Trishneet but he was not affected by it, as now he was absolutely clear about the goal of his life. He left the school to give all his time to follow his dreams and also got himself enrolled in a correspondence course. 
When he was just 22, he started TAC security and today his client list comprises of 50 of Fortune 500 organizations. He has also written three books – “Hacking With Smart Phones”, “Hacking TALK with Trishneet Arora” and “The Hacking Era”. 
Source: Google Images 
This is definitely an amazing feat on the part of a boy who has not even completed schooling. His business has expanded so fast that he has set up offices in UK and Dubai and the turnover has reached to crores annually. 
The story of Trishneet is surely inspirational and it also breaks the belief that regular studies are the only route to success. 
Do share your views with regard to the article in the comments section below.
